'''Notes'''
Gateway laptops are not very popular in shops. This one is very high quality pc, with good speakers and battery lasting for 3 hours even after all those years. It is missing web cam in internal microphone. Card reader suppors SD-HC and maximum DDR2 RAM you can put in it is 3GB. It is interesting how Gateway implemented FN keys. Most of them are from BIOS level, so little notification appears in top left corner independant from OS. For example Fn-F5 displays battery status, wifi mode and V (whathever it is). FN-F8 sets 3 brightnes levels from BIOS level. FN volume keys (Fn-PgUP, Fn-PgDn) are integrated with OS. Fn-F1 disables any lights on laptop including wifi and disk activity (why implement this?)
